a look I’ve not yet seen
when that moment is for them:
my all, my tenderest touch.

for I have an entire body,
ten fingers, two arms,
all for them—
the rest is only ours.

title: noise
content:
static treason
fuzzing
my governance
fusing
juxtapositions of abjectness
fusion
mortal mind
infinite heart

title: damn
content:
drowning in it
thoughts of you
what were you like

the sound of pages
flipping mine and
the script

a short verse
but endless
impact

title: photographic
content:
the bags below your eyes
behind the lensing of your glasses
a night stretched too long
a book to keep you warm

but my memory,
you can’t take it

title: Cardiac Condition
content:
He had an enlarged heart—
I thought it was from his love.
Turns out, it was the burgers.

But it taught me:
There's no limit to how many
people you can love—
or burgers.

title: Forty Seven Fools
content:
So many candles upon the cake.
Thought mad, he asked for them all—
a bigger wish for a better tomorrow, he thought.

Yet life taught him wishes were for fools.
So he took in a breath and blew,
with all his might, hoping just once, perhaps,
this wish might come true.

title: From a Distance
content:
As she draws near, she is the oxygen to my breath,
the wind to the tempest within my heart.
An ocean apart would not be enough—parting the sea
is no small feat, yet I have nothing but time without her.

title: Endless Waltz
content:
f she were keys on a piano, I’d memorize every note.
I’d learn her favorite song and play it endlessly—until
she asked me for another melody. Then, I’d learn every tune.

title: wordle
content:
i get no hints
i keep using letters
i never got her right

title: Last Bastion
content:
A castle called my heart was sieged
Torches and arrows, burning yet piercing
As a single fist beat at the drawbridge
She stood upon water, a miracle calling
Asking it to stop, but all it knew how to do;
Beat back, pleading to a song of longing

title: you don't know me but
content:
i wanted to tell you i love you
but it seemed a bit too forward
see, we haven’t met and
i don't know you
as much as i’d like to, it seems
the cat is out of the hat
and Dr. Seuss only wrote
imaginary things and
nothing of reality

title: penniless
content:
was it an attack or
an act of passion
were those claws or
gnashing teeth
why did it feel so
violently sweet
and why am i
still carrying on
trying to make
cents, a penny for
my troubles

title: miles afloat
content:
and for your worries
so what
that jazz carries
blue ferries across
a black sea
eyes close for that
dream

Written toMiles Davis - So What

title: Piercing
content:
It was hollow—zero gauge.
Out dropped the flesh,
a cylinder of myself, geometric,
mirroring insecurities.

Cosmetic ambivalence,
a freak from birth.

title: Loose the attack
content:
He readied the arrow’s tip,
Licked his lips with pointed purpose,
And drew the string taut—
Not music as one might expect,
But a procession of tension:
Shadows marching on ancient stone,
Lighting the sky with a million arrows,
All aimed at a single grain of sand—
To tip the scale,
To breach the seal, the walled flower’s heart,
And let measured chaos bloom.

title: Figurative Greetings
content:
Nestled, near a vibrant
Heart

Melodic, afar a beat that
Carries

Sheets, hold music waving
Notes

Words, give poetry greetings
Forever

title: Breaching Waters
content:
Have you ever felt
inspiration?

But what if you were
inspiration?

A dam would break—
but could words
shatter the sediment,
carve rivers through ancient stone?

title: Lost Battles
content:
Once, I wrote a novel.
But I was told to let it go—
metaphorically,
for the emotions
were not mine alone.

And theirs,
not for sale.

Buried in trenches,
a battlefield of words unspoken.

title: Nestled Gem
content:
The strata stack meaning,
geology of a heart.
Layered bandages conceal,
suffering sublimation.

Uncovering a new era,
peeling them off, one by one.
Mass wasting, slippery slopes,
stepping softly,
each footfall holding trepidation.

title: Untested Hypothesis
content:
As I counted the moles,
I weighed the compounds of my heart—
molecularized in a pyroclastic event,
a few elements short of fusion.

Yet she burned like the sun,
whether it was physics or chemistry,
I know not the results.

But I brought my lab coat
and goggles, just in case.

title: Lithic Conservator
content:
Trepidation was due,
down came the slew—
a landslide of destruction,
deconstructing a heart.

Lithostatic pressure shards,
pieces eject in jagged parts.

Hands held sharp,
catch bruised chunks
as they tumble,
breaking apart.

title: ivy league
content:
she's never under
scored, larger marks
visible scars
graduated topography
higher degree
affectionately
summa cum laude

title: monumental
content:
mortar to pestle
kessler to stars
lens of light
hubble of constant
dabbling in science
building monuments

title: no escape
content:
it tucks my heart away, cutting frames
the paint drips and stains, cutting canvas
no art remains, so i create, an empty space
to take the pain away, cutting at my heart
and the pool is but a bloodbath for there was

title: To Watch
content:
Gently and patiently, express the longing
with your fingers as you press
buttons I'm unfamiliar with—yours.
So I type, using the buttons I have,
hoping to hit the right notes.

However, my preference would be to see
how you form senses—of touch and embrace—
special places of the most impactful kind.
And as I watch, etch it in marrow;
let every moment linger on my soul,
for a glimpse would not be enough.

title: Binding Clasp
content:
As her hair is lifted,
I embrace the clasp—
two coming together, closely.
My fingertips, lingering,
as does her scent.

That gold necklace is
but an accent,
for she is the gem.

title: Exhalation
content:
Bend an ear—not for hearing,
a nibble on the edge of the lobe.
Nothing like a bite,
but tender lips,
words unspoke.

A shared secret where breath escapes,
a hand brushes her shoulder—shudders.
Shivers quake, swept away,
breaths of yearning,
exhales with more meaning than words.

title: Felt and Forgotten
content:
Static forms as the clouds draw near,
a whisper of storms in the heavy air.
The wool sweater is not enough—
not to keep me, not to hold me,
not to shield me from the weight of rain.

Soaked to the bone, to the marrow,
where rivers carve their silent paths,
etching sorrow in cold relief,
flooding through the fabric
of what was meant to keep me warm.

The fuzz blurs in the downpour,
a storm in the sky, a storm in me.
Both were meant to shelter—
both have failed.

title: Passionate Procession
content:
Never about
what I'd do—
only how it's felt,
how your breath breaks
in hushed moments.

Holding secrets
between sheets,
a million whispers
dissolving into sighs,
paced to the march of my heart.

title: universe knocking
content:
accretion disk forms
bang goes the sol
against fabric's doorstep
ripples in time take me
away, and another bang
wakes me to a new day

title: melting mornings
content:
open eyes, morning light
crying weeps as windows
seep with moisture
poignant dew, leaves
shake the tree
hide the bush
for the cold bites
but her soul, ignites

title: chance encounters
content:
charmed for good luck
but it wasn’t braided, simply entwined
and while fated to stay apart
threads kept them a breath away
never quite able to let go
two sides of the coin
it never stopped spinning
my words spun too
and me in the rain
for her
for you
for every broken heart
still holding lost love

title: unbridled
content:
the gun fires and off to the races
he types while making faces
part mad, part loon, particles too
metaphorically sound
wordplay unbound and into
the sky
jutted, awry— a fragmented mind.
mine.

but the stride hasn’t found its pace
so I keep typing, hoping to get
a grip
or fall into hers

title: florence
content:
there was a river and a glow
a hue and a show
not one of action
of satisfaction
for the view before them lay
endless, widened skies
stroked in oil, a timeless lust
pursed lips, blowing
dust, etching a memory

title: peter panic
content:
as i age, my mind feels younger
time passes strangely, but my body
it tells me lies, it causes me pain
mocking me, whispering "old"
i begin to pout and shake my fists
throwing myself onto the ground—
but it will never be true!

title: beating pangs
content:
more than an echo
it was a bounce
not just sound—
there was percussion,
inflection,
the beat of a heart.
even alone, still worth the pangs—
it only beats stronger.

title: ex-wife
content:
she said he had a
pretty smile—must be why
she had his child

title: unpunctuated capitalism
content:
all it needed was
a good question that was
no one asked a question
where is the punctuation
we all stopped caring
well finally something makes
cents

title: her ink
content:
lines of ink, not my words—
tattoos of hers
i’d memorize every line,
not to miss a drop of spilt ink.

title: expectations
content:
quiet inflection
yet expecting reflections
shattered winter snow

title: cappuccino
content:
a liquid splash—
hissing, swirling,
filling the cup in steady waves.
dark beans brew,
sputtering, spurting,
chasing steam into the air.
milk folds,
spilled and spun to foam,
blooming into a flower—
or a heart, still warm.

title: rummage
content:
when the tank is empty,
no reserve remains,
my frustration finds
depth.

in words of elation—
trepidation of an unstilled
heart that beats for her,
deftly.

not a muse of this world,
pearls and gems unfurled,
laid on a blanket, bare,
delicately.

title: Moving On Myth
content:
Her eyes, clouded, brimming—
a cup overflowing.
My words, though worn, let me try
once more: the tears return,
but the thoughts never fade,
a heart beating never stills—
a stubborn pulse remains.

Written toGoGo Penguin - Hopopono

title: what a chore
content:
it would be a good day to dance
but when is it not, so why are you
not dancing? what’s your excuse
no partner? we have nothing to lose
so why not let it out and foot loose
seems she has laundry to do

Written toGlen Miller - In the Mood

title: muskisms
content:
king of the rocket ships,
thrusters of bluster,
fueling dreams on vaporous claims—
had you but asked, we, the people,
would have gathered, a cosmic force,
to simply throw you at mars,
arms raised—not in awe,
but in relief.

title: Ode to Lacrimosa
content:
And do you whisper now,
these words birthed like cosmic seeds within your voice,
Resonating softly in the hollows of your breath,
Each syllable a fragile echo in star-dusted distances?
Do you taste their form, how vowels flow like liquid notes,
And find, in their hum, the promised tenderness they hold?

In the hush of dark matter, these phrases linger,
a pianissimo suspended—
A lacrimosa of half-lit choirs and trembling strings,
swelling to horns
That weave through galaxies, carving an aria in the endless black.
Instruments roar like quasars, radiant with fervent abandon,
Harmonics racing at light speed through collapsing quantum fields
And glittering debris of shattered stars.

Behold, the universe draped in veils of evolving light:
A wondrous loom of nebulae, gravity's arcs, and swirling constellations,
Stitched in patterns that merge, multiply, and recoil in unseen symmetries.
Between the waltz of galaxies and the hush of cold dust,
Cosmic truths unfold where a teardrop of sound
Sends energy rippling, rewriting the boundaries of the known.

Violins keen like comets, carving sounds of raw emotion,
Trumpets flare like solar winds across event horizons,
And timpani shake the void as if time itself might be reborn—
Amidst this grandeur, two hearts ignite, small sparks in a colossal night.

Entangled by forces subtle as a boson's wink, they spin,
Pulses echoing the unseen dance of universal constants,
Fusing their fragments into a geometry beyond flesh and form.
From darkness they emerge, as if destiny sculpted warmth from the void,
Kindling a flame where silence and indecipherable night once reigned.

In the half-light where silence breathes with sound,
Their emotions rewrite chords: no longer lament, but a symphony of becoming.
Their union, once yearned for, now aches in resonance through cosmic arches—
A narrative born of starlight, carried on waves unseen but felt,
Where the tapestry spreads, infinite, embracing both silence and song.

When the final cadence fades to distant echoes,
And sound retreats into the hush of time folding upon itself,
Know that these words, these trembling notes cast into the void,
Have woven something immortal in their delicate dance.

All that was shadowed now gleams with purpose,
a radiant thread drawn taut,
Binding their paths, inseparable from the start,
Spanning from the quiet spark of becoming to the brilliant blaze of forever.

Written toLacrimosa

title: visceral vase
content:
and without thought, stopped
interjected by music, enthralled by memories
categorically trying to close off my emotions
focusing with intensity to task
to make write what was undone
for my words are mine alone and i stand strong
not but a man, banalities, a human, flesh and heart
more than the moment passed, beyond judgment
as none should be so frail to let them cut you
emboldened and brazened by the tempered life lived
and at the end when everything is broken i ask but once more
shatter me again, so i can feel

Written toEternal Eclipse - Hidden Machines

title: footnote
content:
he had been tender and gentle
smart and witty
he was too good
to be true?
he had been until that moment
and as he begged forgiveness
i had no choice,
exhausted from the drama,
but to step on him
to use him
as a launch pad for my life

title: barrels and holes
content:
snicker-snack,
drawn to attack,
words that latch,
mind—off track.

donning a hat,
madness and thatch,
ceiling shatters,
nothing matters.

down the rabbit hole,
past the grassy knoll,
a phantom waits—

bang.

title: wordslikewater
content:
it's good that we're mostly water,
because these words flow through
my heart.

they move like the warmth of a hug,
thoughts from above
or afar.

and yet—do you linger,
waiting, hoping,
for a word hidden in verse,
apart...

or a part of me?

Written toDROELOE - Lilypads

title: dante
content:
cloaks of myth,
hidden in shadow,
ponder, now wonder—
drift into the abyss.

scabbards drawn
to parry the scythes,
no harvest to reap,
no fields to find—
only mist.

title: creation
content:
it felt like the right time to cut,
so i carved my heart away, little by whittle,
thinking i was so witty—yet witless in strife,
sharpening the knife as though my life

depended on the edge of madness.
it became a statue—one of defiance, of her,
for her worth could never be measured,
but a monument worth creation—

even if only with words.
would you question such verse?

title: intensity
content:
if it were the last thing in my life,
i'd push forward, beyond—
no end in sight, for impetus remains,
ceaseless, climbing.

no goal, just the ascent,
aspirations rising,
titles abandoned,
words left between the lines.

and if one read the whole way through,
they'd hear a symphony—
one of melancholy and triumph,
for the heart beats,
bearing the weight of a life, of many,
stronger than fathomable.

into heights unknown,
a man overinflated
by ego and hubris.

title: lifeline
content:
rough waters, tough tides,
words crash down, pulling sides—
paddle hard,
grab the line,
hold on tight.
we're entwined.
survive.

title: let me go
content:
let me go would only matter if i could hold on.
i value autonomy, so explain the taxonomy
of those words.

use your best verse,
let meaning disperse,
for i never understood,
as if i ever could.

was it a plea or a command,
a whisper or a demand?

title: long drive
content:
curves carve the mountain road
through picturesque siena.
scents fade, yet i breathe deeper.
less a race, more a journey—
so why does my heart quicken?

title: her every wish
content:
knocked over with emotion, laying side by side
knot in his heart, not in reality, just inside
yearning to run a hand through her hair, with a smile and a stare
something simple, nothing explicit, that would ruin it
for the tenderest wish it is, not even a kiss
just her knowing, he’d tend to her every wish

Written toGRiZ - Floating

title: metaphorically
content:
how do i explain the infinite,
how can i write and mean it?
the truth in my heart is miles apart
from anyone i've ever met, it seems.

i've traveled and i've traveled,
but in a moment—
someone struck me,
and suddenly,
it became everything.

metaphorically.

title: ignis origami
content:
crumpled stock,
tossed and burned—
words reduced to ash.
yet from ruin,
beauty rises,
pride rekindled in the flame.
cherished,
even if perished—
not gone, but reborn.

title: Becoming art
content:
It’s a favor, a splatter, a finding, a pattern:
particles.

Ask, and you’ll be all that matters—
matter.

A life‐changing sequence of events:
time.

What prevents abstract probabilities from
existence?

title: 我が懐
content:
Some endings are neither bitter
nor sweet—
just moments to fold away.

But she fell in love
with something still beating,
a pulse I can’t quiet.

I might be dreaming,
but it just might be poetry.

title: lost luggage
content:
it was but a carry-on,
lugged and checked at the last moment,

forgotten on a turnstile.
as it kept going round, it realized—
there wasn’t much inside.

was it that unimportant?
it guessed so,
laid to rest where feet stay.

title: fragile eggman
content:
drums snap, snares ensnare, syncopated beats flare
two hearts, tangled lines, short time, felt longer there
pain expressed, she left—he rhymed, hoping for more
time to write the verse, to right the words, restore

but when he slipped, he tipped—he fell, without any grip
humpty dumpty, loud crash, whole scene became alit
yolk spilled out, thick stench, no coming back
crowd dispersed—left alone, no more shell, just cracks

title: send it
content:
gripping the crimp,
heel hooking firm,
the problem before him
nearly solved.

one last deadpoint,
a drive through the core—
mantling up,
he tops out.

title: Dunning Penny
content:
The coin that spun soon lost its shine,
I pocketed it, thinking theirs mine—
A dime? A penny? No trouble at all,
Lost in their logic, too sure to recall.

They’d studied enough—or so they had thought,
Yet there they are, assured—and still wrong.

title: soon they feast
content:
no clean end, the blade dulled,
worn too thin to cut.
bread unbroken, they waited,
each willing the other to starve first.

title: relish in it
content:
as i began to care for the universe,
knowing it could never care for me,
they called me mad.
but no madness rivals the universe's own—
its chaos, my kin.
one day, i return to it.

title: heart aflight
content:
a rush like wind beneath fragile wings,
the weight of fear turned into flight,
each pulse a whisper of soaring heights.
